paragraphs.text: “Can anyone imagine The Lord’s Prayer recited in a classroom?” Founder and President Martin Mawyer said in a statement on CAN’s website. “Or students taught that the Bible is the inspired, infallible final Word of God? Or displaying the Christian cross in the school classroom? Or lesson plans that encourage students to pray to Jesus Christ? It’s out of the question! Christ, the Bible, the cross and Christian prayer were thrown out our public schools decades ago.”
paragraphs.name: 8d6b

5a81c3dbdd81.title: It seems that most readers on this site are supportive of the DOE sponsoring a program that aims to…

paragraphs.text: It seems that most readers on this site are supportive of the DOE sponsoring a program that aims to develop empathy for both Muslims and Islam. If you take an honest look at it, most observers would have to conclude that this is not merely an academic look at the sociology of Muslims or a history of the Islamic religion.

a27e8cc33687.title: 9/11 happened at the start of my freshman year in high school, and I remember world religions…

paragraphs.text: 9/11 happened at the start of my freshman year in high school, and I remember world religions, including Islam, being incorporated into world history lessons afterward. The textbooks we used in TX, however, did offer similar information about Christianity, Judaism, Buddhism, and Hinduism. It was not an endorsement for or against any of the religions…
paragraphs.name: 9c1b

paragraphs.text: Let’s look at this from the, admittedly warped, view of right wingers. They consider all of Islam to be the enemy. Shouldn’t people know as much as they possibly can about the enemy? Someone’s forgetting their Sun Tzu. But their hatred blinds them and always has. Especially to the fact that, no, Islam is not our enemy. It is conservative extremists of every kind.

paragraphs.text: Yup, I can imagine this. Because these things aren’t illegal, per se. To teach ABOUT a religion is not akin to teaching it AS a religion. So there is zero prohibition from teaching that Christians believe Jesus rose from the dead, or this is the prayer that Christians pray, etc. I wish Christians would research the law a bit more before they spouted off about what was “thrown out” of public schools.
paragraphs.name: ebab
